__data__.text:
Education is crucial for a progressive society, and it is essential to ensure that every child has access to high-quality education. In India, the government has introduced various programs aimed at providing accessible and free education to all children, especially those from marginalized communities.

Advantages of Free Education Programs in India
Free education programs offer several benefits, including:

1. Increased Enrollment: More children can attend school by removing financial barriers.

2. Enhanced Literacy Rates: Access to free education has significantly improved literacy rates nationwide.

3. Gender Equality: Special programs for girls ensure equal education opportunities.

4. Social Upliftment: Education empowers children from marginalized communities to break the cycle of poverty.

5. Holistic Development: These programs often include provisions for mid-day meals, uniforms, and books, ensuring the overall well-being of the children.

10 Government Schemes For Free Education in India
Organizations like CRY - Child Rights and You are dedicated to ensuring that every child receives the education they deserve. This blog outlines the top 10 government schemes, which have played a significant role in transforming the education system in India.

Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA)
Launched in 2001, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA) aims to provide universal elementary education to children aged 6-14 years. The program focuses on bridging gender and social gaps in education, improving the quality of education, and enhancing school infrastructure.

Right to Education (RTE) Act
The Right to Education (RTE) Act, enacted in 2009, mandates free and compulsory education for children aged 6-14 years. The act ensures that every child has the right to quality education without any discrimination and sets minimum standards for schools.

National Programme for Education of Girls at Elementary Level (NPEGEL)
NPEGEL is a focused intervention to reach the "Hardest to Reach" girls, especially those not in school. This program provides additional support for enhancing the education of girls from disadvantaged communities, including Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and minorities.

Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao (BBBP)
Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao (BBBP)
The Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao program aims to address the declining child sex ratio and promote the education and empowerment of girls. Launched in 2015, the program focuses on changing societal attitudes towards girls and ensuring their education and participation.

National Scheme of Incentives to Girls for Secondary Education
This program encourages the enrollment of girls in secondary education, particularly those from Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes. It provides financial incentives to girls who have passed class VIII and enroll in secondary school.

Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA)
RMSA aims to enhance access to secondary education and improve its quality. Launched in 2009, the program seeks to universalize secondary education by providing a secondary school within a reasonable distance of every habitation and improving school infrastructure.

Samagra Shiksha
Samagra Shiksha is a comprehensive program that integrates three previous schemes: SSA, RMSA, and Teacher Education (TE). It aims to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education from preschool to senior secondary levels. The program focuses on digital education, vocational training, and teacher training.


CBSE Udaan Program
The CBSE Udaan program aims to address the low enrollment of girls in prestigious engineering and technical institutions. It provides free online resources, tutorials, and mentoring to female students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds to help them prepare for engineering entrance exams.

Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV)
KGBV aims to provide quality education to girls from disadvantaged communities in rural areas. The program establishes residential schools for girls at the upper primary level, ensuring that they have access to education in a safe and supportive environment.

Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
Although primarily a savings program, Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana indirectly supports the education of girl children. The program allows parents to save for their daughters' education and marriage, providing financial security for their future educational needs.

By addressing financial, social, and infrastructural barriers, these programs have made significant strides in ensuring that every child, regardless of their background, has access to quality education. Organizations like CRY - Child Rights and You play a crucial role in advocating for these rights and supporting the implementation of these programs. Through collective efforts, we can ensure that every child in India enjoys their right to education, paving the way for a more equitable future.

Join us and donate to help children get the education they deserve and give them a brighter future!

According to the Central Statistical Institute of India, there were 3.3 million NGOs registered in India as of 2009. That is one NGO for every 400 citizens. Still, India faces so many social and economic challenges. Several charity organizations work to address these issues. In this blog, we will introduce you to the top 10 genuine charity organizations in India. These NGOs have demonstrated their dedication to various causes. Through their dedicated service, they have earned the trust of countless individuals and communities.



India's nonprofit sector is key in addressing a wide range of social and humanitarian challenges. Many NGOs work to provide education and healthcare. Some other NGOs work to alleviate poverty and conserve the environment. Individuals like you and corporations support these NGOs in their noble causes by donating frequently.

List of Top 10 NGOs in India
Here is a list of the Top 10 Genuine Charity Organizations in India:

Team Everest
CRY (Child Rights and You)
Smile Foundation
GiveIndia Foundation
HelpAge India
Akshaya Patra Foundation
Goonj
Project Nanhi Kali
SERUDS
Pratham Education Foundation
1. Team Everest
Team Everest's mission is to inspire everyone to volunteer and create a culture of giving. They do this by creating volunteering opportunities throughout the year, where anyone from the age of 3 to 95 can volunteer. Team Everest is recognized as one of India's leading NGOs committed to promoting volunteering and making it a way of life. For 17 years, they have been at the forefront of promoting volunteering through initiatives aligned with the Sustainability Development Goals, blending a professional approach with genuine passion.



Team Everest operates in 12 cities - Bangalore, Chennai, Coimbatore, Delhi, Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Kochi, Kolkata, Madurai, Mumbai, Noida, and Pune. Team Everest has conducted many corporate volunteering programs for 250+ corporate partners including IBM, Ford, Tata, Freshworks, etc. The NGO also provides scholarships to college students, with a commitment to making education accessible to all.



Location: Chennai, Tamil Nadu
Year Founded: 2006
Website: www.teameverest.ngo
Founder: Karthee Vidya
Email: volunteer@teameverest.ngo
Phone: +91 89399 12365
Address: No. 147, 2nd Street, Shanthi Nagar, Chromepet, Chennai - 600044.
Volunteer Now 
Or

Join our WhatsApp Community
2. CRY (Child Rights and You)
CRY is an NGO dedicated to protecting the rights of children. They work to end child labour and improve access to education and healthcare. They advocate for policies that protect the well-being of India's underprivileged children. CRY addresses needs like healthcare, nutrition, education, and protection from child labour and child marriage.



Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra
Year Founded: 1979﻿
3. Smile Foundation
Smile Foundation is an NGO working for the welfare of children. This organization commits to providing education, healthcare, and support to orphans and underprivileged children. Some of their notable programs include Smile on Wheels, Mission Education, and Smile Twin e-learning.



Location: New Delhi
Year Founded: 2002﻿
4. GiveIndia Foundation
Give India Foundation is India's largest donation platform. It serves as a vital bridge between donors and many NGOs nationwide. Their mission encompasses diverse causes, including education, healthcare, and environmental initiatives. This non-profit organization operates as an online donation platform. They connect individuals from India and around the world to trusted NGOs. It enables donors to make meaningful contributions. Through their website, GiveIndia raises and distributes funds.



Location: Bengaluru
Year Founded: 1999﻿
5. HelpAge India
HelpAge India is an organization committed to enhancing the lives of elderly citizens. They provide essential healthcare services, support livelihoods, and advocate for the well-being and dignity of senior citizens. The organization's mission includes improving the living standards of underprivileged elderly individuals. HelpAge India takes action against pension disparities, inadequate healthcare access, and elder abuse. They have age-specific care programs to address the needs of disadvantaged elders.



Location: New Delhi
Year Founded: 1978﻿
6. Akshaya Patra Foundation
The Akshaya Patra Foundation provides mid-day meals to schoolchildren. The Akshaya Patra Foundation dedicates itself to tackling hunger in classrooms. Their mission is to supply nutritious meals to school children. They also support the Right to Education of children coming from challenging backgrounds.



Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka
Year Founded: 2000﻿
7. Goonj
Goonj NGO is an organization combating clothing poverty and promoting rural development. The organization collects surplus clothing and essential materials and distributes them to underprivileged communities. Moreover, Goonj's work extends to disaster relief, humanitarian aid and community development.

Location: New Delhi
Year Founded: 1978﻿
6. Akshaya Patra Foundation
The Akshaya Patra Foundation provides mid-day meals to schoolchildren. The Akshaya Patra Foundation dedicates itself to tackling hunger in classrooms. Their mission is to supply nutritious meals to school children. They also support the Right to Education of children coming from challenging backgrounds.



Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka
Year Founded: 2000﻿
7. Goonj
Goonj NGO is an organization combating clothing poverty and promoting rural development. The organization collects surplus clothing and essential materials and distributes them to underprivileged communities. Moreover, Goonj's work extends to disaster relief, humanitarian aid and community development.



Location: New Delhi
Year Founded: 1999﻿
8. Project Nanhi Kali
Nanhi Kali's primary mission is to empower underprivileged girl children through education. They offer comprehensive support, including academic help, essential resources, and mentorship programs. They aim to help girls overcome obstacles and complete their education. The Naandi Foundation and KC Mahindra Education Trust manage this initiative. Through Project Nani Kali, the organization strives to educate and influence girls and women.



Location: Mumbai
Year Founded: 1996﻿
9. SERUDS
SERUDS NGO India is a dedicated organization committed to the betterment of marginalized communities. They strive to make a positive impact through a comprehensive range of programs, including education, healthcare, livelihood development, and assistance for vulnerable groups like children, women, and the elderly. By focusing on these key areas, SERUDS plays a crucial role in addressing the multifaceted challenges faced by underserved people, ultimately working towards a more equitable and inclusive society.



Location: Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh
Year Founded: 2003
10. Pratham Education Foundation
Pratham Education Foundation focuses on providing quality education to financially poor children. They started by providing education to children in the slums of Mumbai. They are one of the largest NGOs in the country focusing on high-quality, low-cost programs to address gaps in the education system. From early childhood education to vocational training, they work directly with communities and in partnership with governments to bring children to school.



Location: New Delhi
Year Founded: 1995
